subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit in Netbean
msgSnippet: ... If you have NetBeans 4.1, it s already there. Hit Alt+F6 to run the tests. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
sungfatcivic wrote:
> Hi there,
>
> I am new to JUnit . Do I have to somehow insert the JUnit framework in
> my Netbean IDE in order to use it?

If you have NetBeans 4.1, it's already there. Hit Alt+F6 to run the tests.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
